TITLE: A global treaty to curb plastic pollution failed. An ocean conservation expert outlines next steps.
SUMMARY: Marce Gutiérrez-Graudiņš, who works to preserve marine resources, spoke about her group’s ongoing conservation efforts in the U.S. as she readies for future international talks

TITLE: Jimmy Carter wanted to see Guinea worm disease eradicated. He came very close.
SUMMARY: The Carter Center for decades has led a fight against Guinea worm disease around the world. This year, preliminary data indicates just 11 cases were recorded

TITLE: The first meteor shower of 2025 will peak this week
SUMMARY: The annual Quadrantid meteor shower has begun, with the best show expected during the early hours of Friday

TITLE: Orca who carried dead newborn for weeks has lost another calf and is carrying it again
SUMMARY: An orca mother carried her dead calf with her for miles in 2018. Now, she is repeating the behavior with a newly deceased baby whale

TITLE: To the moon, an asteroid and beyond: The biggest space missions ahead in 2025
SUMMARY: A new year of space exploration is beginning. The planned missions include several lunar landings, the launch of a new cosmic observatory and China’s rendezvous with an asteroid

TITLE: 'Dinosaur highway' tracks dating back 166 million years are discovered in England
SUMMARY: “These footprints offer an extraordinary window into the lives of dinosaurs,” one micropaleontology professor said

TITLE: Lead pollution in ancient Rome may have dropped average IQ, study finds
SUMMARY: Researchers linked lead found in ice samples from Greenland to ancient Roman silver smelters, suggesting the pollution was pervasive enough to affect much of Europe

TITLE: NASA overhauls plan to bring samples from Mars back to Earth
SUMMARY: For more than 20 years, NASA has been inching toward the goal of retrieving samples that its Perseverance rover has been collecting on Mars and flying them to Earth

TITLE: Four fires grow, forcing more than 80,000 evacuations around L.A.
SUMMARY: The Palisades Fire has already burned through almost 3,000 acres, while two other fires have destroyed a further 1,500 acres. Tens of thousands have been evacuated

TITLE: Water tanks went dry in Pacific Palisades, hampering efforts to fight fire
SUMMARY: Three tanks and some fire hydrants temporarily lost water because of high demand. Experts said the system wasn’t built to fight a major blaze like this one

TITLE: 'Entirely foreseeable': The L.A. fires are the worst-case scenario experts feared
SUMMARY: The blazes are the result of a combination of suburban sprawl in fire-prone areas, fierce Santa Ana winds, dry conditions fueled by climate change and the limits of firefighting

TITLE: What does it mean to 'contain' a wildfire?
SUMMARY: Containment refers to firefighting efforts meant to limit the spread of wildfires, using natural barriers and human-made hurdles such as trenches

TITLE: Drinking water could be contaminated in L.A. County areas affected by wildfires, experts say
SUMMARY: Some communities have been instructed not to drink tap water as officials worry about fire-related contaminants entering the water system

TITLE: Jeff Bezos' New Glenn rocket reaches orbit on first test flight
SUMMARY: All seven main engines fired at liftoff as the rocket blazed through the predawn sky to the delight of spectators lining nearby beaches. Blue Origin envisions six to eight New Glenn flights this year, with the next one coming up this spring

TITLE: Two lunar landers launch to the moon aboard a SpaceX rocket
SUMMARY: One of the missions is carrying 10 NASA science instruments to the moon. The other involves a "micro rover" to explore a region in the moon’s far north

TITLE: What is the pink powder sprayed over the California fires?
SUMMARY: The key ingredient in the fire retardant is ammonium phosphate, which is commonly found in fertilizer

TITLE: SpaceX loses its Starship rocket in test flight but catches its booster after launch
SUMMARY: During the seventh test flight of SpaceX's Starship rocket, the company lost communication with the upper stage. The ship broke up during its ascent burn, SpaceX said

TITLE: SpaceX says its Starship spacecraft broke up midflight as videos of debris emerge online
SUMMARY: The rocket company said the space vehicle came apart during its ascent. Videos posted to social media showed debris streaking through the sky

TITLE: Los Angeles home survived the fire, only to be split in two by a landslide
SUMMARY: After wildfires destabilize hillsides, the risk of landslides grows, making episodes like this more likely in the future

TITLE: Turks and Caicos officials say SpaceX debris littered islands but no injuries reported
SUMMARY: Videos emerged online shortly after the incident showing glowing debris streaking across the sky

TITLE: When houses are fuel: Why firefighting was no match for a California disaster decades in the making
SUMMARY: Why firefighting was no match for a California disaster decades in the making

TITLE: California leaders promise a quick rebuild, but that may put homes at risk of fire again
SUMMARY: Reconstructing fire-ravaged neighborhoods in their former image could make residents sitting ducks for future blazes, experts say

TITLE: Trump will pull U.S. out of Paris climate agreement
SUMMARY: The agreement was meant to ensure global cooperation in reducing the amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere

TITLE: Trump's executive orders might threaten growth of electric vehicles and wind power
SUMMARY: Advocates strongly criticized the orders, which target two of the fastest-growing climate technologies in the U.S

TITLE: It's big, rare and dead smelly: Visitors flock to see the 'corpse flower' in bloom
SUMMARY: Visitors gathered in Sydney to witness the blooming of the rare and endangered flower Amorphophallus titanum, which opens for just 24 hours once every few years

TITLE: Much-needed rain forecast for Southern California this weekend
SUMMARY: Although it could help firefighting efforts, the expected precipitation also brings risks of mudslides, flash flooding and toxic runoff

TITLE: Alabama woman becomes longest living recipient of pig organ transplant
SUMMARY: Only four other Americans have received hugely experimental transplants of gene-edited pig organs — two hearts and two kidneys — and none lived more than two months

TITLE: FDA recommends pet food companies revisit safety plans amid bird flu outbreak
SUMMARY: Cats appear to be especially vulnerable to the H5N1 virus

TITLE: In cleanup from California fires, lithium-ion batteries are a dangerous challenge
SUMMARY: The batteries, used in electric vehicles, can explode or ignite if damaged or overheated

TITLE: Earthquake off Maine rattles New England
SUMMARY: Moderate shaking was reported in parts of Maine, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and New Hampshire

TITLE: More than 1,000 EPA employees are told they could be dismissed immediately
SUMMARY: An email last week informed some workers that they had been identified as probationary and could be terminated

TITLE: 66-million-year-old vomit fossil discovered in Denmark
SUMMARY: The rare find, which was discovered at Stevns Klint, a coastal region off the Baltic Sea, reveals ancient predator-prey dynamics

TITLE: A test that aims to rule out autism using a strand of hair is now available to the public
SUMMARY: A startup called LinusBio says its test can help doctors rule out autism spectrum disorder in children 1 to 36 months old

TITLE: AI, wars and climate change mean it's later than ever on the 'Doomsday Clock'
SUMMARY: The group whose "clock" rates how far humanity is from ending cited climate change, nuclear proliferation, Middle East instability and the threat of pandemics, among other factors

TITLE: Conditions that fueled L.A. fires were 35% more likely because of climate change, scientists find
SUMMARY: A new report analyzed weather and climate models to evaluate how a warmer atmosphere is shifting the likelihood of wildfires

TITLE: Trump's DEI policy threatens already thin share of women and minorities in STEM, workers say
SUMMARY: While women make up more than half of the U.S. population, they constituted about a third of all people in STEM jobs as of 2021

TITLE: In NASA asteroid samples, scientists discover key building blocks of life
SUMMARY: An analysis of material taken from the asteroid Bennu suggests the chemical ingredients for life may have been widespread across the early solar system

TITLE: A giant leap for roo-kind as scientists produce first kangaroo embryo through IVF
SUMMARY: Kangaroos aren't endangered, but Australia — one of the world’s most biodiverse countries — also has the highest rate of mammal extinction. A breakthrough may help fix that

TITLE: How weather driven by climate change helped fuel the Southern California fires
SUMMARY: Al Roker talks to climate scientist Alexander Gershunov about the conditions that made the L.A. wildfires so devastating

TITLE: Planet parade: Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn and Mercury make for a skywatching spectacle
SUMMARY: The best time to see the planets is after dusk on a clear night in a spot that is away from city lights and other forms of light pollution

TITLE: Staff placed on leave, map tool shut down in tumultuous week at EPA
SUMMARY: This week, 168 EPA staffers were put on administrative leave, with more layoffs expected. Several agency staffers described an atmosphere of fear and foreboding

TITLE: Recording captured the chilling sound of the Titan submersible's final moment
SUMMARY: The recording was made by a passive acoustic recorder about 900 miles from where the OceanGate vessel met its end on June 18, 2023

TITLE: Judge blocks Trump administration from cutting research funding after 22 states sue
SUMMARY: The National Institutes of Health said it would limit indirect funding for research projects to 15%, dramatically slashing how much funding the federal government would provide to research agencies

TITLE: Las Vegas finally breaks its streak of 214 dry days — with 0.01 inches of rain
SUMMARY: This is only the second time in 88 years that Las Vegas has experienced 200 days or more without rain, according to the National Weather Service

TITLE: NASA says yes, an asteroid buzzing by in 2032 could hit Earth
SUMMARY: But — importantly — the chances are still "extremely low," though they have ticked up since the object was first detected

TITLE: Jurassic bird fossil rewrites history of avian evolution
SUMMARY: Birds with modern-day features roamed the skies millions of years earlier than previously thought, according to a study published in the journal Nature

TITLE: Blizzard in the North and floods in the South while severe storms batter eastern U.S.
SUMMARY: Around 20 million people are under some measure of flood alert from Arkansas to Pennsylvania

TITLE: Scientists racing to discover the depth of ocean damage from L.A. wildfires
SUMMARY: Fire debris and potentially toxic ash could make the water unsafe for surfers and swimmers, especially after rain that can transport chemicals, trash and other hazards into the sea

TITLE: Science under siege: Trump cuts threaten to undermine decades of research
SUMMARY: Sweeping layoffs, funding freezes and executive orders have provoked outcry among federal researchers and their university partners, who fear that science itself is under siege

TITLE: Measles outbreak grows bigger in rural Texas, and officials expect more cases
SUMMARY: Out of the 58 new cases over the past three weeks, 13 people have been hospitalized

TITLE: What to know about vaccine booster shots as measles spreads in Texas
SUMMARY: The protective elements of a few routine childhood vaccinations may wane over time

TITLE: That asteroid heading near Earth in 2032? The impact probability is now just 0.004%, NASA says
SUMMARY: The space rock, which briefly had a 3.1% chance of hitting Earth, is now expected to pass safely. The astronomer who invented the scale used to measure such risks explains the dizzying shifts

TITLE: World's oldest runestone may have been signed by a woman, researchers say
SUMMARY: Runic inscriptions often bore messages, including spells to bring back the dead and charm words

TITLE: Katy Perry, Gayle King and Lauren Sánchez to go to space with Jeff Bezos' rocket company
SUMMARY: The celebrities join three other women as the crew of the coming Blue Origin journey, which is set to launch this spring

TITLE: A new lunar lander is set to launch to the moon's south pole this week
SUMMARY: It will be the second lunar mission for a private company that made history a year ago by becoming the first to successfully land on the moon’s surface

TITLE: Seven planets share the sky at once this week, but the parade of planets ends soon
SUMMARY: Five of the seven planets may be visible with the naked eye. But after Friday, Mercury and Saturn will appear too faint and too low on the horizon for most people to see

TITLE: A privately built spacecraft has successfully landed on the moon
SUMMARY: The robotic lander, dubbed Blue Ghost, touched down on the lunar surface early Sunday. It’s a feat that only one other private company has ever accomplished

TITLE: SpaceX stands down from launch of its Starship rocket
SUMMARY: A fiery explosion ended the system's last test flight, sending debris streaking through the sky and raining over parts of Turks and Caicos

TITLE: One sent tsunami alerts. Another flew with 'hurricane hunters.' Both were just fired from NOAA.
SUMMARY: The Trump administration last week cut about 600 workers at NOAA and the National Weather Service

TITLE: Inflammation is a 'double-edged sword': How to protect against chronic disease
SUMMARY: Longevity experts see fighting chronic inflammation as key to healthier aging

TITLE: NASA space observatory poised to launch on a mission to map 450 million galaxies
SUMMARY: NASA's SPHEREx mission is expected to map the entire sky four times over two years, offering a window into how the universe came to be

TITLE: Astronauts launching to space will finally relieve the pair who flew on Boeing's troubled capsule
SUMMARY: A new astronaut crew's arrival at the International Space Station will kick off the process of bringing Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore back to Earth

TITLE: 5 years later, long Covid is still a medical mystery. Here's what scientists have learned.
SUMMARY: Why do some people develop disabling chronic conditions after the initial viral infection

TITLE: Measles is unlike other viruses: What to know about complications including 'immune amnesia'
SUMMARY: The virus targets certain types of immune cells in the body, destroying them in the process

TITLE: After several delays, NASA's SPHEREx launches in mission to map 450 million galaxies
SUMMARY: The spacecraft’s instruments will observe the cosmos in 102 different colors, or wavelengths, which NASA has said is more than any previous mission

TITLE: Fossilized face fragments are oldest human ancestor remains ever found in Western Europe
SUMMARY: The fossil is mysterious, however: It can't be conclusively identified as any known human ancestor species

TITLE: EPA administrator announces huge rollback of environmental regulations
SUMMARY: Lee Zeldin said he will reconsider a list of core EPA policies, including emissions standards for vehicles and the finding that serves as the basis for addressing climate change

TITLE: A volcano near Alaska's largest city could erupt in coming weeks or months, scientists say
SUMMARY: Mount Spurr is one of 53 volcanoes in Alaska that have been active within the last 250 years

TITLE: NASA astronauts' launch to the space station is delayed
SUMMARY: Once it does happen, the flight will kick off a series of events culminating in NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore’s long-awaited trip back to Earth

TITLE: A total lunar eclipse made its way across the U.S. Thursday night
SUMMARY: The Earth’s shadow covered the moon for just over an hour, giving it a reddish hue

TITLE: Johns Hopkins University to let more than 2,000 workers go after Trump's USAID cuts
SUMMARY: It’s one of several universities laying off workers or implementing hiring freezes as they reckon with sweeping reductions to government funding

TITLE: Private moon lander falls silent after two-week lunar mission
SUMMARY: It’s lights out for the Blue Ghost lander from Firefly Aerospace — the first private lunar lander to pull off a fully successful moon mission

TITLE: NASA's stuck astronauts welcome their newly arrived replacements to the space station
SUMMARY: Weather permitting, Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams will undock from the space station with two other astronauts no earlier than Wednesday

TITLE: NASA astronauts return after unexpected nine months in space
SUMMARY: Problems with Boeing's Starliner capsule forced Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore to stay on the International Space Station far longer than planned. They're finally home

TITLE: After 9 months in space, NASA astronauts who flew on Boeing's capsule are on their way home
SUMMARY: Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore originally planned to stay just a week on the space station, but problems with their Boeing vehicle forced them to remain there until this week

TITLE: Fired NOAA staffers are reinstated, creating confusion on the heels of severe storms
SUMMARY: The agency had already halted several services because of staffing issues following the cuts, including some weather balloon launches. It is not clear whether those will resume

TITLE: How will the universe end? A changing understanding of dark energy may provide a new answer
SUMMARY: The big question is whether dark energy is a constant force, which scientists have long thought, or whether the force is weakening. New findings bolster the case for the latter

TITLE: Saturn's rings will temporarily 'disappear' this weekend
SUMMARY: The angle between Earth and Saturn will briefly create something of a cosmic illusion, in which the planet’s rings look invisible from our vantage point

TITLE: RFK Jr. praises cellphone bans in schools, citing mix of science and misinformation
SUMMARY: Kennedy pointed to evidence-based links between social media use and depression, but shared an unfounded claim that cellphones increase cancer risk

TITLE: A movement to ban food dyes gains ground across the U.S., backed by RFK Jr.
SUMMARY: More than a dozen states have introduced bills this year to crack down on artificial dyes and other food additives

TITLE: LatAmGPT aims to create AI that better represents Latin America's diversity
SUMMARY: A coalition of research institutions is working on the tool to offer users more accurate responses that take into account language variances and culturally specific details

TITLE: With fewer weather balloons after government staffing cuts, forecasts may be less accurate
SUMMARY: At least 10 sites have suspended or limited weather balloon launches, which used to occur twice daily, because of the Trump administration’s cuts to the National Weather Service

TITLE: Chinese researchers report a pig kidney transplant and a first-step liver experiment
SUMMARY: Scientists are genetically altering pigs so their organs are more humanlike in hope of alleviating a transplant shortage

TITLE: A Venus flytrap wasp? Scientists uncover an ancient insect preserved in amber that snatched its prey
SUMMARY: Scientists reported that the ancient wasp may have zipped among the dinosaurs using a body like a Venus flytrap to seize and snatch its prey

TITLE: Los Angeles sheriff retesting 4,000 DNA samples due to possible error
SUMMARY: "We take the integrity of our criminal investigations and the reliability of our forensic testing very seriously,” L.A. County Sheriff Robert Luna said

TITLE: A stroke survivor speaks again with the help of an experimental brain-computer implant
SUMMARY: The interface works in real time, a development meant to avoid delays that can disrupt the natural flow of conversation and lead to miscommunication

TITLE: Water shortage threatens the world's most abundant lithium reserves
SUMMARY: Global lithium demand is expected to grow by 40 times by 2040

TITLE: NASA astronauts open up about being 'stuck' in space for 9 months
SUMMARY: Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore spent 286 days on the International Space Station after technical issues bedeviled their weeklong mission

TITLE: Scientists release plans for an even bigger atom smasher to address the mysteries of physics
SUMMARY: The plans for the Future Circular Collider would create a nearly 56.5-mile loop along the French-Swiss border and below Lake Geneva

TITLE: ACLU sues National Institutes of Health for 'ideological purge' of research projects
SUMMARY: The lawsuit says NIH has canceled more than 670 research grants, which were due more than $1.1 billion in funding
